newsitem.title: JAPAN: PRESS DIGEST - Top Japan business news - July 18.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Top Japan business news - July 18.

text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in the Japanese press on Friday, as reported by Kyodo news agency.
-- Nikko Securities Co Ltd and Smith Barney International Inc agree on individual asset management.
-- The Association of South East Asian Nations (ASEAN) signals willingness to accept Cambodia under new leadership.
-- Finance Ministry to give tax benefits to stock option system.
-- Power Reactor and Nuclear Fuel Development Corp (PNC) to penalise 24 officials for cover-up in sodium leak accident at Monju prototype fast-breeder reactor.
-- Science and Technology Agency to trim space development budget by 100 billion yen by 2003.
-- Utility fees will be reduced in October.
-- Minamata Bay in Kumamoto Prefecture, once affected by mercury poisoning, declared safe.
